titleStmt.title: The Printer to the courteous and Gentlemen Readers.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: The Printer to the courteous and Gentlemen Readers.

monogr.title: Two tales, translated out of Ariosto: the one in dispraise of men, the other in disgrace of women. VVith certaine other Italian stanzes and prouerbs. By R.T. gentleman
monogr.author: Ariosto, Lodovico

div.head: The Printer to the courteous and Gentlemen Readers.
div.p: GEntlemen, these two Tales translated out of ARIOSTO, and the other Stanzies following, were not done by this Translator, to compare (as it were) with master HARRINGTONS verses (for he acknowledgeth himselfe euery way his inferiour) but for his owne priuate exercise, and at the earnest intreatie of some gentlemen his friends, all which he did in the yeere 1592. he being then in Italie: Yet the rather is hee content they should come abroad, because that by the harshnes of the one, you may perceiue the sweetenesse of the other. And thus not doubting of your wonted curtesies, I commit my selfe, and them to your fauourable constructions, and so bid you farewell.
